snippet: Gov. Jay Nixon on Friday halted what was to have been the first execution in the United States to use propofol, after threats from the European Union to limit exports of the drug if it was used to carry out the death penalty.
abstract: Missouri Gov Jay Nixon halts what was to have been the first execution in the United States to use propofol, after threats from the European Union to limit exports of the drug if it was used to carry out the death penalty.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jay Nixon on Friday halted what was to have been the first execution in the United States to use propofol, after threats from the European Union to limit exports of the drug if it was used to carry out the death penalty.

headline.main: Missouri: Propofol Use in Execution Is Rejected
headline.print_headline: Missouri: Propofol Use In Execution Is Rejected
